document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of Tullbergiidae (Collembola, Poduromorpha) from Xinjiang province, Northwest China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and records of Tullbergiidae (Collembola, Poduromorpha) from Xinjiang province, Northwest China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Shanghai Natural History Museum, Shanghai Science & Technology Museum, Shanghai 200041, China & gaoy @ sstm. org. cn; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0003 - 0305 - 3696
Shanghai Natural History Museum, Shanghai Science & Technology Museum, Shanghai 200041, China

heading.emphasis:
Mesaphorura critica Ellis, 1976
, new record to China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
10 females (slide Nos. XJ-2016001–XJ-2016004), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Aletai City , Buerjin County , Jiadengyu , 48°29’ N 87°08’E , elev.
1450 m
, soil samples from mixed forest,
18-VIII-2016
;
25 females (slide Nos. XJ-2016005–XJ-2016021), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Aletai City , Buerjin County , Hemu village , 48°33’ N 87°25’E , elev.
1150 m
, soil samples from broad-leaf forest,
20-VIII-2016
;
7 females (slide Nos. XJ-2016005–XJ-2016021), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Aletai City , Buerjin County , Kanasi Lake , 48°40’ N 87°01’E , elev.
1300 m
, soil samples from broad-leaf forest,
24-VIII-2016
;
7 females (slide Nos. XJ- 2016027–XJ-2016033), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Aletai City , Habahe County , 48°04’ N 86°20’E , elev.
470 m
, soil samples from broad-leaf forest,
27-VIII-2016
;
15 females (slide Nos. XJ-2016034–XJ-2016037), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Bole City , Hariturege Park , 45°08’N 81°46’E , elev.
1125 m
, soil samples from the forest of
Populus euphratica
,
31-VIII-2016
;
45 females (slide Nos. XJ-2016046–XJ-2016054), Northwest China , Xinjiang Province , Bole City , Sailimu lake , 44°29’N 81°09’E , elev.
2100 m
, soil samples from coniferous forest,
1-IX-2016
, all specimens are collected by Cheng-Wang Huang.

Diagnosis. Postantennal organ with 26–32 simple compressed vesicles in two parallel rows; pseudocelli of type I, with formula of 11/011/10011, and situated between setae m5 and p5 on Th. II and III; sensillum b on Ant. IV distinctly thinker than others; Abd. IV with setae m4 and m5, p1 as microseta and p2 as macroseta; Abd. V with only two microsetae a1 and a3 between macroseta a4 (a2 absent), sensillum p3 spindle-like; anal lobes with l3’ present, l2’ absent.

Description of Chinese materials. Adult body 0.47 mm long on average ( 0.45–0.50 mm , n = 30). Dorsal setae well differentiated into micro- and macrosetae ( Figs 36–39 ). Granulations on body fine. Pso formula as 11/011/10011 from head to abdomen, 8–9 μm in diameter, type I ( Figs 33, 36–37 ). On Th. II and III each with one pair of lateral pso between setae m5/p5, close to m5 ( Fig. 36 ); pso on Abd. I and IV posterior to seta p3 ( Figs 37, 39 ), on Abd. V between the borders of Abd. V and VI ( Fig. 39 ).

Antenna (60–65 μm) shorter than head (70–80 μm). Antennal segment IV with five thickened sensilla a–e, sensillum b dinstinctly thicker than others. Small microsensillum, subapical organite and one apical vesicle present. Antennal organ III consists of two small sensory rods concealed behind one large papilla and two thick sensory clubs bent toward each other, with four guard setae; one large ventral sensory club present.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 32–41.
Mesaphorura critica Ellis, 1976
. 32, habitus; 33, head, dorsal view; 34–35, postantennal organs of different individuals; 36, Th. II and Th. II, left side; 37, Abd. I, left side; 38, Abd. II and III; 39, Abd. IV and V; 40, ventral tube; 41, Abd. V and VI, ventral view.

TABLE 4. Adult chaetotaxy of
Mesaphorura critica Ellis, 1976

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Xinjiang ); known from Palearctic and South Australia.

Remarks .
Mesaphorura critica
was first found in sands in Greece . It is widely distributed in the world, from North Europe ( Greenland and Norwary) to North Africa ( Morocco , Senegal ), from Spain to Russia , and also recorded from South Australia ( Greenslade 1992 ). It was usually found in dry open habitats such as meadows or the shore, rarely in forest ( Dunger & Schlitt 2011 ). We found it occurred in different kinds of forests of Xinjiang frequently and with high density.
